wikipedia_page.main: Ronald Carlile Buxton (20 August 1923 – 10 January 2017) was a Chartered Structural Engineer, successful businessman, and Conservative Party politician in the United Kingdom.

response: The result of the contest was not as planned: the Conservative Party candidate, Ronald Buxton, won with a majority of 205 votes, a swing from Labour of 8.7%. Gordon-Walker regained the seat for Labour at the 1966 general election.
*Ronald Buxton (British politician) (1923–2017), Conservative Member of Parliament for Leyton, 1965–1966

response: *Ronald Buxton, 93, British politician, MP for Leyton (1965–1966).Ronald Carlile Buxton
